name: Pickthall
text: Ta. Ha.

name: Pickthall
text: We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur'an that thou shouldst be distressed,

name: Pickthall
text: But as a reminder unto him who feareth,

name: Pickthall
text: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens,

name: Pickthall
text: The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne.

name: Pickthall
text: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, and whatsoever is between them, and whatsoever is beneath the sod.

name: Pickthall
text: And if thou speakest aloud, then lo! He knoweth the secret (thought) and (that which is yet) more hidden.

name: Pickthall
text: Allah! There is no Allah save Him. His are the most beautiful names.

name: Pickthall
text: Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses?

name: Pickthall
text: When he saw a fire and said unto his folk: Lo! Wait! I see a fire afar off. Peradventure I may bring you a brand therefrom or may find guidance at the fire.

name: Pickthall
text: And when he reached it, he was called by name: O Moses!

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord, So take off thy shoes, for lo! thou art in the holy valley of Tuwa.

name: Pickthall
text: And I have chosen thee, so hearken unto that which is inspired.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I, even I, am Allah, There is no Allah save Me. So serve Me and establish worship for My remembrance.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! the Hour is surely coming. But I will to keep it hidden, that every soul may be rewarded for that which it striveth (to achieve).

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor, let not him turn thee aside from (the thought of) it who believeth not therein but followeth his own desire, lest thou perish.

name: Pickthall
text: And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I bear down branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Cast it down, O Moses!

name: Pickthall
text: So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Grasp it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state.

name: Pickthall
text: And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white without hurt. (That will be) another token.

name: Pickthall
text: That We may show thee (some) of Our greater portents,

name: Pickthall
text: Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).

name: Pickthall
text: (Moses) said: My Lord! relieve my mind

name: Pickthall
text: And ease my task for me;

name: Pickthall
text: And loose a knot from my tongue,

name: Pickthall
text: That they may understand my saying.

name: Pickthall
text: Appoint for me a henchman from my folk,

name: Pickthall
text: Aaron, my brother.

name: Pickthall
text: Confirm my strength with him

name: Pickthall
text: And let him share my task,

name: Pickthall
text: That we may glorify Thee much

name: Pickthall
text: And much remember Thee.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses.

name: Pickthall
text: And indeed, another time, already We have shown thee favour,

name: Pickthall
text: When we inspired in thy mother that which is inspired,

name: Pickthall
text: Saying: Throw him into the ark, and throw it into the river, then the river shall throw it on to the bank, and there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall take him. And I endued thee with love from Me that thou mightest be trained according to My will,

name: Pickthall
text: When thy sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will nurse him? and we restored thee to thy mother that her eyes might be refreshed and might not sorrow. And thou didst kill a man and We delivered thee from great distress, and tried thee with a heavy trial. And thou didst tarry years among the folk of Midian. Then camest thou (hither) by (My) providence, O Moses,

name: Pickthall
text: And I have attached thee to Myself.

name: Pickthall
text: Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in remembrance of Me.

name: Pickthall
text: Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).

name: Pickthall
text: And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed or fear.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that he may play the tyrant.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Fear not. Lo! I am with you twain, Hearing and Seeing.

name: Pickthall
text: So go ye unto him and say: Lo! we are two messengers of thy Lord. So let the children of Israel go with us, and torment them not. We bring thee a token from thy Lord. And peace will be for him who followeth right guidance.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! it hath been revealed unto us that the doom will be for him who denieth and turneth away.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto everything its nature, then guided it aright.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: What then is the state of the generations of old?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither erreth nor forgetteth,

name: Pickthall
text: Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for you therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We have brought forth divers kinds of vegetation,

name: Pickthall
text: (Saying): Eat ye and feed your cattle. Lo! herein verily are portents for men of thought.

name: Pickthall
text: Thereof We created you, and thereunto We return you, and thence We bring you forth a second time.

name: Pickthall
text: And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and refused.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O Moses?

name: Pickthall
text: But we surely can produce for thee magic the like thereof; so appoint a tryst between us and you, which neither we nor thou shall fail to keep, at a place convenient (to us both).

name: Pickthall
text: (Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let the people assemble when the sun hath risen high.

name: Pickthall
text: Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed tryst).

name: Pickthall
text: Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth faileth miserably.

name: Pickthall
text: Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they kept their counsel secret.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from your country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions;

name: Pickthall
text: So arrange your plan, and come in battle line. Whoso is uppermost this day will be indeed successful.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: O Moses! Either throw first, or let us be the first to throw?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then lo! their cords and their staves, by their magic, appeared to him as though they ran.

name: Pickthall
text: And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.

name: Pickthall
text: We said: Fear not! Lo! thou art the higher.

name: Pickthall
text: Throw that which is in thy right hand! It will eat up that which they have made. Lo! that which they have made is but a wizard's artifice, and a wizard shall not be successful to whatever point (of skill) he may attain.

name: Pickthall
text: Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he is your chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for certain which of us hath sterner and more lasting punishment.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We choose thee not above the clear proofs that have come unto us, and above Him Who created us. So decree what thou wilt decree. Thou wilt end for us only this life of the world.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the magic unto which thou didst force us. Allah is better and more lasting.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell. There he will neither die nor live.

name: Pickthall
text: But whoso cometh unto Him a believer, having done good works, for such are the high stations;

name: Pickthall
text: Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever. That is the reward of him who groweth.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).

name: Pickthall
text: Then Pharaoh followed them with his hosts and there covered them that which did cover them of the sea.

name: Pickthall
text: And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them.

name: Pickthall
text: O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and we made a covenant with you on the holy mountain's side, and sent down on you the manna and the quails,

name: Pickthall
text: (Saying): Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and transgress not in respect thereof lest My wrath come upon you: and he on whom My wrath cometh, he is lost indeed.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and believeth and doeth good, and afterward walketh aright.

name: Pickthall
text: And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O Moses?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: They are close upon my track. I hastened unto Thee, my Lord, that Thou mightest be well pleased.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Lo! We have tried thy folk in thine absence, and As-Samiri hath misled them.

name: Pickthall
text: Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad. He said: O my people! Hath not your Lord promised you a fair promise? Did the time appointed then appear too long for you, or did ye wish that wrath from your Lord should come upon you, that ye broke tryst with me?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We broke not tryst with thee of our own will, but we were laden with burdens of ornaments of the folk, then cast them (in the fire), for thus As-Samiri proposed.

name: Pickthall
text: Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave forth a lowing sound. And they cried: This is your god and the god of Moses, but he hath forgotten.

name: Pickthall
text: See they not, then, that it returneth no saying unto them and possesseth for them neither hurt nor use?

name: Pickthall
text: And Aaron indeed had told them beforehand: O my people! Ye are but being seduced therewith, for lo! your Lord is the Beneficent, so follow me and obey my order.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till Moses return unto us.

name: Pickthall
text: He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them gone astray,

name: Pickthall
text: That thou followedst me not? Hast thou then disobeyed my order?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I feared lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel, and hast not waited for my word.

name: Pickthall
text: (Moses) said: And what hast thou to say, O Samiri?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I perceived what they perceive not, so I seized a handful from the footsteps of the messenger, and then threw it in. Thus my soul commended to me.

name: Pickthall
text: (Moses) said: Then go! and lo! in this life it is for thee to say: Touch me not! and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst not break. Now look upon thy god of which thou hast remained a votary. Verily we will burn it and will scatter its dust over the sea.

name: Pickthall
text: Your Allah is only Allah, than Whom there is no other Allah. He embraceth all things in His knowledge.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus relate We unto thee (Muhammad) some tidings of that which happened of old, and We have given thee from Our presence a reminder.

name: Pickthall
text: Whoso turneth away from it, he verily will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection,

name: Pickthall
text: Abiding under it - an evil burden for them on the Day of Resurrection,

name: Pickthall
text: The day when the Trumpet is blown. On that day we assemble the guilty white-eyed (with terror),

name: Pickthall
text: Murmuring among themselves: Ye have tarried but ten (days).

name: Pickthall
text: We are Best Aware of what they utter when their best in conduct say: Ye have tarried but a day.

name: Pickthall
text: They will ask thee of the mountains (on that day). Say: My Lord will break them into scattered dust.

name: Pickthall
text: And leave it as an empty plain,

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein thou seest neither curve nor ruggedness.

name: Pickthall
text: On that day they follow the summoner who deceiveth not, and voices are hushed for the Beneficent, and thou hearest but a faint murmur.

name: Pickthall
text: On that day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom the Beneficent hath given leave and whose word He accepteth.

name: Pickthall
text: He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind them, while they cannot compass it in knowledge.

name: Pickthall
text: And faces humble themselves before the Living, the Eternal. And he who beareth (a burden of) wrongdoing is indeed a failure (on that day).

name: Pickthall
text: And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he feareth not injustice nor begrudging (of his wage).

name: Pickthall
text: Thus we have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have displayed therein certain threats, that peradventure they may keep from evil or that it may cause them to take heed.

name: Pickthall
text: Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad) with the Qur'an ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee, and say: My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We found no constancy in him.

name: Pickthall
text: And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, they fell prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused.

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor we said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.

name: Pickthall
text: It is (vouchsafed) unto thee that thou hungerest not therein nor art naked,

name: Pickthall
text: And that thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun's heat.

name: Pickthall
text: But the devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee the tree of immortality and power that wasteth not away?

name: Pickthall
text: Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent unto them, and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so went astray.

name: Pickthall
text: Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Go down hence, both of you, one of you a foe unto the other. But when there come unto you from Me a guidance, then whoso followeth My guidance, he will not go astray nor come to grief.

name: Pickthall
text: But he who turneth away from remembrance of Me, his will be a narrow life, and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the Day of Resurrection.

name: Pickthall
text: He will say: My Lord! Wherefor hast Thou gathered me (hither) blind, when I was wont to see?

name: Pickthall
text: He will say: So (it must be). Our revelations came unto thee but thou didst forget them. In like manner thou art forgotten this Day.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus do We reward him who is prodigal and believeth not the revelations of his Lord; and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be sterner and more lasting.

name: Pickthall
text: Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many a generation We destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they walk? Lo! therein verily are signs for men of thought.

name: Pickthall
text: And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord, and a term already fixed, the judgment would have been inevitable (in this world).

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor (O Muhammad), bear with what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord ere the rising of the sun and ere the going down thereof. And glorify Him some hours of the night and at the two ends of the day, that thou mayst find acceptance.

name: Pickthall
text: And strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among them to enjoy, the flower of the life of the world, that We may try them thereby. The provision of thy Lord is better and more lasting.

name: Pickthall
text: And enjoin upon thy people worship, and be constant therein. We ask not of thee a provision: We provided for thee. And the sequel is for righteousness.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord! Hath there not come unto them the proof of what is in the former scriptures?

name: Pickthall
text: And if we had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they would assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy revelations before we were (thus) humbled and disgraced!

name: Pickthall
text: Say: Each is awaiting; so await ye! Ye will come to know who are the owners of the path of equity, and who is right.
